section_id: ## Appendix A: Statement of Key Foundational Results

hints.label: thm-c1-regularity-appendix
hints.title: C¹ Regularity and k-Uniform Gradient Bound (from [07_adaptative_gas.md](07_adaptative_gas.md))
hints.content:
712: :label: thm-c1-regularity-appendix
713: 
714: The ρ-localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i) = g_A(Z_\rho[f_k, d, x_i])$ is C¹ in $x_i$ with gradient satisfying:
715: 
716: $$
717: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)\| \leq F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)
718: $$
719: 
720: where:
721: 
722: $$
723: F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) = L_{g_A} \cdot \left[ \frac{2d'_{\max}}{\sigma'_{\min,\text{bound}}} \left(1 + \frac{2d_{\max} C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho d'_{\max}}\right) + \frac{4d_{\max}^2 L_{\sigma'_{\text{patch}}}}{\sigma'^2_{\min,\text{bound}}} \cdot C_{\mu,V}(\rho) \right]
724: $$
725: 
726: with the **k-uniform** (thus N-uniform) bound on variance derivative:
727: 
728: $$
729: C_{\mu,V}(\rho) = 2d'_{\max} \left(d_{\max} + d'_{\max}\right) + 4d_{\max}^2 \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho}
730: $$
731: 
732: **Parameter Definitions:**
733: - $L_{g_A}$: Lipschitz constant of the squashing function $g_A$
734: - $d_{\max}$: Maximum value of the fitness measurement function $d(x)$
735: - $d'_{\max}$: Maximum gradient norm of $d(x)$: $\sup_x \|\nabla d(x)\|$
736: - $\sigma'_{\min,\text{bound}}$: Lower bound on the regularized standard deviation
737: - $L_{\sigma'_{\text{patch}}}$: Lipschitz constant of the variance regularization patch
738: - $C_{\nabla K}(\rho)$: Bound on the gradient of the localization kernel (ρ-dependent)
739: 
740: **k-Uniformity:** The bound $F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)$ is **independent of the alive count $k$** (and thus of the swarm size $N$) due to two key properties:
741: 1. **Telescoping property:** $\sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}_k} \nabla w_{ij} = 0$ for the normalized localization weights
742: 2. **Effective support:** Only $k_{\text{eff}}(\rho) = O(1)$ walkers within the ρ-neighborhood contribute significantly
743: 
744: This k-uniformity is crucial for Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-adaptive-velocity-bound`: it ensures the bound on collective adaptive acceleration remains constant regardless of swarm size.
745: 
746: **ρ-Dependence:** The bound depends on $\rho$ through:
747: - $C_{\nabla K}(\rho)$: For Gaussian kernels, $C_{\nabla K}(\rho) \sim 1/\rho$
748: - Thus $F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) = O(1/\rho)$ for fixed $\epsilon_\Sigma$
749: 
750: This ρ-dependence establishes the trade-off between localization resolution and adaptive force magnitude.
